description: Bypass method configuration for the Jury-Rigging subsystem

bypassMethods.name: Percussive Maintenance
bypassMethods.description: Strike the mechanism with calculated force to jar components into alignment.
risks: May permanently break the mechanism on fumble

flavorText.attempt: You raise your hand and strike the mechanism with precise force.
flavorText.success: Something clicks into place. The mechanism responds favorably.
flavorText.failure: The machine buzzes angrily but holds firm.
flavorText.fumble: Your strike goes awry—something shatters within. The mechanism is ruined.

bypassMethods.name: Wire Manipulation
bypassMethods.description: Access internal wiring to bypass security circuits directly.
risks: Electrocution risk: FINESSE DC 12 or 2d10 lightning damage

flavorText.attempt: You pry open the access panel, exposing tangled wires crackling with dormant energy.
flavorText.success: Your nimble fingers dance between live circuits. The lock disengages with a soft click.
flavorText.failure: The wires resist your manipulation. You'll need another approach.
flavorText.fumble: Your probe slips—lightning arcs through your body before the mechanism sparks and dies.
flavorText.electrocutionSaved: Your nimble fingers dance around the live wires. A spark leaps toward you but you pull back just in time.
flavorText.electrocutionFailed: Lightning arcs through your hands! The current courses through your body before you can wrench yourself free.

bypassMethods.name: Glitch Exploitation
bypassMethods.description: Exploit the mechanism's corrupted behavior patterns.

flavorText.attempt: You watch the mechanism's erratic behavior, searching for a pattern in the chaos.
flavorText.success: You time your action perfectly with the glitch cycle—the mechanism yields.
flavorText.failure: The glitch patterns shift unpredictably. You'll need to observe longer.
flavorText.fumble: The glitch cascades catastrophically—the mechanism destroys itself.
flavorText.unavailable: This mechanism is too stable for glitch exploitation.

bypassMethods.name: Memorized Sequence
bypassMethods.description: Apply a previously memorized activation sequence.
risks: Only works on mechanism types you've bypassed before

flavorText.attempt: Your fingers move from memory, recalling the sequence from previous encounters.
flavorText.success: Muscle memory guides you true. The familiar mechanism responds as expected.
flavorText.failure: Something is different about this model. Your memorized sequence doesn't quite work.
flavorText.fumble: Your confidence betrays you—the mechanism rejects the sequence violently.
flavorText.unavailable: You haven't encountered this mechanism type before.

bypassMethods.name: Brute Disassembly
bypassMethods.description: Tear apart the mechanism to force access, destroying it in the process.
risks: Destroys the mechanism, but guarantees component salvage

flavorText.attempt: You grip the mechanism's housing and begin systematically tearing it apart.
flavorText.success: Piece by piece, the mechanism comes apart in your hands. Useless now—but you have what you need.
flavorText.failure: The housing resists your efforts. This will take more force.
flavorText.fumble: The mechanism breaks apart explosively, destroying any usable components.

bypassMethods.name: Power Cycling
bypassMethods.description: Cut and restore power to reset the mechanism to its default state.
risks: Resets all progress, including partial successes

flavorText.attempt: You locate the power coupling and prepare to cut the circuit.
flavorText.success: The mechanism goes dark, then hums back to life—now responsive to your commands.
flavorText.failure: The mechanism reboots but remains locked. At least it's no longer in lockout.
flavorText.fumble: The power surge fries the circuits. The mechanism is dead.

familiarityBonus.description: Characters familiar with a mechanism type gain +2d10 bonus dice on experiment rolls.

criticalSuccess.description: Net successes >= 5 yields salvageable components from the mechanism.
